extendedIngredients.name: cherry tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: ½ cup cherry tomatoes, cut in half
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup cherry tomatoes, cut in half

extendedIngredients.name: fresh cilantro
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tbsp cilantro, chopped, fresh is best if you have it
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tbsp cilantro, chopped, fresh is best if you have it
extendedIngredients.originalName: cilantro, chopped, fresh is best if you have it

extendedIngredients.name: mango
extendedIngredients.original: 1 bag of frozen organic mango (I use Earthbound Farms)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bag of frozen organic mango (I use Earthbound Farms)
extendedIngredients.originalName: frozen organic mango (I use Earthbound Farms)

extendedIngredients.name: orange juice
extendedIngredients.original: ¼ cup freshly squeezed orange juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup freshly squeezed orange juice

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb of frozen cooked shrimp - medium
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 lb of frozen cooked shrimp - medium

title: Mango Shrimp Ceviche | Healthy Holiday s

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Santa Cristina by Antinori Pinot Grigio with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Cristina by Antinori Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: The 2012 wine is deep straw-yellow in color. This classic Pinot Grigio offers intense aromas of tropical fruit and citrus. Soft and flavorful on the palate with flavors of pineapple and pear, this wine has well-balanced acidity and a long finish.

instructions: Defrost the shrimp according to the package directionsPlace the shrimp in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oilStir in the mangoes, tomatoes, onion and cilantro. Drizzle orange juice over the top & toss to combine.Season with salt & pepper. Cover. Chill up to 8 hours.

steps.step: Defrost the shrimp according to the package directions
Place the shrimp in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil
Stir in the mangoes, tomatoes, onion and cilantro.
Drizzle orange juice over the top & toss to combine.Season with salt & pepper. Cover. Chill up to 8 hours.
